title: Coral reef calculations and ocean acidification

content.question: Directions: The suggested time for answering this question is about 22 minutes. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. Coral reefs are produced when corals acquire calcium ions ( <math><semantics><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3962@</annotation></semantics></math> ) and carbonate ions ( <math><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mtext>3</mtext></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A47@</annotation></semantics></math> ) from seawater and deposit solid <math><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCO</mtext></mrow><mtext>3</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation></semantics></math> to form their exoskeletons. Scientists are concerned that relatively rapid decreases in ocean water pH will hinder the deposition of <math><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCO</mtext></mrow><mtext>3</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation></semantics></math> . The graph above shows the amount of <math><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mtext>2</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation></semantics></math> dissolved in ocean water and ocean water <math><semantics><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeiCaiaabIeaaaa@37B2@</annotation></semantics></math> (shown in parentheses) since 1850 and the predicted changes through 2100. Explain how an increase in the amount of dissolved <math><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mtext>2</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation></semantics></math> in ocean water results in a decrease in the <math><semantics><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeiCaiaabIeaaaa@37B2@</annotation></semantics></math> of ocean water. Explain why the movement of carbon into the ocean has been increasing since 1850. In order to model the effects of ocean acidification on coral reefs, some simplifying assumptions can be made. Use the assumptions in the table below to perform the calculations that follow. Calculate the current annual global increase in volume, in <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>m</mtext> <mtext>3</mtext> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeyBamaaCaaaleqabaGaae4maaaaaaa@37C7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CaCO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in coral reefs. Show all steps in your calculation. Calculate the current annual global increase in mass, in kg, of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CaCO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in coral reefs. Show all steps in your calculation. Because of ocean acidification, it is expected that in 2050 the mass of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CaCO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation> </semantics> </math> deposited annually in coral reefs will be 20 percent less than is deposited currently. Calculate how much less <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CaCO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A18@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , in kg, is expected to be deposited in 2050 than would be deposited if ocean water <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>pH</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeiCaiaabIeaaaa@37B2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> were to remain at its current value. Identify and describe one likely negative environmental impact of the loss of coral reefs. Identify one environmental problem (other than one due to ocean acidification or loss of coral reefs) that affects marine ecosystems on a global scale.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain environmental concepts and processes.
